events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 28th, requesting to initiate the insurance claim process due to damages sustained on their vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in the reported collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim, responsible for guiding the customer through the claims process and collecting necessary details.
The customer received confirmation that their claim for the auto accident had been acknowledged and was now under review by the insurance team.
The agent requested the customer to submit the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the repair estimate from the auto shop for further processing.
The customer uploaded the requested police report, clear images of the damaged vehicle, and the official repair estimate to support their insurance claim.
The claims department began a detailed investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision and assessed all submitted documentation.
The investigation concluded that the accident was covered under policy terms, and no discrepancies were found in the submitted documents or reports.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the full cost of repairs, factoring in depreciation and policy deductibles.
The customer confirmed acceptance of the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the communication and claim handling so far.
Following customer acceptance, the claim received formal approval from the claims manager to proceed with payment issuance.
The approved settlement amount was transferred to the customerâ€™s designated bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed after the payment was confirmed received and the customer indicated the repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All files and documentation related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
